item.title: Tech Headlines: 9th December 2019
item.author: Sudarshan Sreeram,
item.description: Qualcomm XR2 - 5G Ready AR Glasses At a special event in Maui, Hawaii, Qualcomm announced its new AR platform - XR2 5G, which succeeds the company’s older XR1 platform that still powers a number of VR and AR experiences. According to Qualcomm, the XR2 is the world’s first 5G-supported extended …

item.title: Augmented Reality and Intelligence Automation
item.author: Sudarshan Sreeram,
item.description: Everyone’s heard of artificial intelligence, more commonly known as AI, but have you heard of intelligence augmentation, or IA? No, it’s not an illegal substance that alters your thinking capabilities to make you highly intelligent; though, it does come close! IA is closely linked with AI, but it …

item.title: Tech Headlines: 29th November 2019
item.author: Sudarshan Sreeram,
item.description: Cybertruck Unveil Elon Musk announced Tesla’s new electric pickup truck - Cybertruck. The physical appearance of the truck sure caught everyone off guard. With a low-poly inspired futuristic aesthetic, this truck challenges the conventional design of modern vehicles in general, let alone pickup …

item.description: Above: The Ford Mustang Mach-E Audi E-Tron Sportback At the LA motor show, Audi unveiled its second electric vehicle, the Audi E-Tron Sportback. item.title: The Huawei Ban
item.author: Sudarshan Sreeram,
item.description: Sci-fi based movies and television series often show a person or a group of people in their mid to late 20s cut off power to an entire city by hacking into a power grid or steal data from a ‘target’ by hacking their internet connected devices. A well-known example of this is CW’s “The Flash”, where …

item.title: Automation and Virtual Assistants
item.author: Sudarshan Sreeram,
item.description: The past decade has seen the rise of digital virtual assistants and a big boom in the home automation industry. item.title: The Form Factor of Modern Smartphones
item.author: Sudarshan Sreeram,
item.description: Smartphones, and mobile phones in general, are nothing but merely an extension of the human mind; to put it simply, these devices serve as external information banks and keep us connected with the outside world. Always adapting and evolving to meet the needs of the consumer, the form-factor (i.e. …
